snippet: To an unparalleled degree, Pope Francis will make a point of spending time with day laborers and refugees, the homeless and disabled, underprivileged schoolchildren and prisoners.
abstract: Pope Francis is making unprecedented effort to connect with ordinary Americans during his first visit to United States, with seven scheduled events to interact with ordinary people; meetings, while brief, represent Pope's belief that church exists to help poorest and most marginalized citizens.

byline.original: By ANDY NEWMAN and VIVIAN YEE
byline.contributor: Nicholas Fandos contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: To an unparalleled degree, Pope Francis will make a point of spending time with day laborers and refugees, the homeless and disabled, underprivileged schoolchildren and prisoners.

headline.print_headline: Pope Meeting Offers Brush With Grace for Those on the Margins
headline.main: Pope Francis, on U.S. Visit, Will Reach Out to the Struggling

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Our Lady Queen of Angels (East Harlem, NY)
